Key Match Events: Shakib Al Hasan scored 64* off 46 balls, his first fifty in 20 T20I innings.
Rishad Hossain took 3 wickets for 33 runs, changing the course of the game.
Mustafizur Rahman bowled economically, conceding just 3 runs in the 19th over and 1 run in the 17th over.
Bangladesh won by 25 runs, securing a step closer to the Super Eights.
Post-Match Reflections: Shakib Al Hasan expressed happiness with his contribution, noting it wasn't an easy wicket.
The result knocked Sri Lanka out of contention and gave Bangladesh an excellent chance of advancing from Group D.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the first international fixture in Kingstown in close to a decade.
Weather or pitch conditions were not mentioned as affecting the match.
